narrative_summary: In the last 48 hours, multiple drone incidents have raised significant concerns over prison security and criminal activities across various locations. Most notably, several reports highlight the use of drones to smuggle contraband into prisons in Georgia, with alerts from local law enforcement regarding the ongoing threat they pose. On the law enforcement side, drones have been effectively utilized to locate and apprehend burglary and domestic violence suspects. Notably, incidents in Moldova regarding a Russian drone crash and ongoing drone surveillance in Lithuania over border tensions highlight escalating international tensions. Additionally, airport disruptions due to potential drone sightings were reported in Brussels, indicating potential policy implications on drone regulations. Overall, the trends point towards an increasing reliance on drone technology both for illegal activities and law enforcement responses.

clusters.rationale: Increase in contraband delivered via drones to prisons highlights vulnerabilities.
Drones are increasingly being used effectively to track and apprehend suspects.
Incidents involving drones in Moldova and Lithuania reflect growing geopolitical tensions.
